word.definition: to say that you are sorry for sth
word.example: We apologize for the late departure of this flight.

word.definition: to make a formal request for a job
word.example: He applied for a senior job in the marketing department.

word.definition: a formal arrangement to meet or visit sb
word.example: She made an appointment to see her lawyer.

word.definition: to send a copy of a document with an email
word.example: I have attached the agenda for next week’s meeting.

word.definition: a copy of a document that is sent with an email
word.example: I got the email, but for some reason I didn’t get the attachment.

word.definition: to send sb a bill (=a document showing how much they owe for goods or services)
word.example: Her job is to bill customers and chase unpaid invoices.

word.definition: the use of a name, logo (=symbol) and design for a company or group of products, so that people will recognize them
word.example: We use corporate branding on all our letters.

word.definition: a small card printed with sb’s name, job and details of the company they work for
word.example: They exchanged business cards.

word.definition: letters that a person or company receives or sends
word.example: The first thing I do every day is look through my correspondence.

word.definition: a written record of your education and the jobs you have done, that you send when you are applying for a job
word.example: Complete the application form and attach your CV.

word.definition: a form that you sign when goods or documents are delivered
word.example: Don’t sign the delivery note until you have checked the order is complete.

word.definition: a place for storing documents or computer files
word.example: I keep copies of all my invoices in this folder.

word.definition: to send or pass goods or information to sb
word.example: He got a complaint from a customer, which he forwarded to me.

word.definition: information from a computer that has been printed out
word.example: Can you send everyone a hard copy of the report?

word.definition: a list of goods that have been sold or work that has been done, showing what sb must pay
word.example: A supplier called to ask why her invoice had not been paid.

word.definition: one single thing that can be bought
word.example: Can I pay for each item separately?

word.definition: an occasion when people meet together to discuss or decide sth
word.example: We have a team meeting every Monday morning.

word.definition: something that is not correct, or produces the wrong result
word.example: I made a mistake and sent the email to the wrong person.

word.definition: a document that is used for ordering goods
word.example: Don’t forget to put the delivery address on the order form.

word.definition: the written work that is part of a job, such as filling in forms or writing letters
word.example: I have an assistant to help me with my paperwork.

word.definition: a meeting at which a product, idea, or piece of work is shown to a group of people
word.example: The sales manager will give a presentation on the new line of products.

word.definition: to produce letters, pictures, etc. on paper using a printer (a machine)
word.example: I printed a copy of the order for my files.

word.definition: a document that shows that goods or services have been paid for
word.example: Keep the receipt, so you can claim your expenses.

word.definition: to get something which sb has sent to you
word.example: Did you receive the files I sent you?

word.definition: to put information on a computer or on a disk so the information is not lost
word.example: Don’t forget to save your work regularly.

word.definition: to copy a document using a special machine and save it as a computer file
word.example: How do I scan a photo and attach it to an email?

word.definition: to make a letter, package, or email go to a place
word.example: Could you send me some pricing information please?

word.definition: a piece of work that sb has to do
word.example: Our first task is to set up the computer and printer.
